summary: The bill, titled the "Modernizing America with Rebuilding to Kickstart the Economy of the Twenty-first Century with a Historic Infrastructure-Centered Expansion Act," addresses infrastructure, climate change, and economic recovery. It proposes eliminating certain fuel excise taxes and implementing a tax on greenhouse gas emissions to fund infrastructure projects. The bill establishes a trust fund for revenue distribution, allocates funds to various programs (including infrastructure, environmental initiatives, and worker assistance), and amends existing laws. It also creates a National Climate Commission to set emissions reduction goals and assess existing policies.
